optimal_commit_size.description: Commits with focused changes (few files, moderate lines)

focused_changes.description: Commits focused on single file type or related files

recommendations.title: Maintain Message Quality Standards
recommendations.description: Continue requiring detailed commit messages with explanatory bodies. 90.4% of commits follow this pattern with 0.77 confidence score.
action_items: Document commit message templates in CONTRIBUTING.md
Share examples of excellent commit messages

recommendations.title: Encourage Focused Commits
recommendations.description: Strengthen the pattern of logically cohesive commits. 82.6% currently follow this with 0.66 confidence.
action_items: Include commit organization in code review checklist
Provide examples of well-organized commit sequences

recommendations.title: Flexible Commit Sizing
recommendations.description: Optimal size pattern (2-3 files, ~33 lines) shows positive correlation but allow flexibility. Don't enforce strict limits.
action_items: Suggest breaking up large commits when logical
Focus on logical cohesion over absolute size

recommendations.title: Investigate Success Measurement
recommendations.description: 100% success rate suggests specific measurement point. Enhance learning to capture full lifecycle.

recommendations.title: Expand Future Analysis
recommendations.description: Enhance learning system to capture additional metrics for deeper insights.
action_items: Track commits that required rework or reverts
Analyze timing patterns (creation vs merge time)
Correlate commit attributes with review feedback

key_insights: Message quality is the strongest success factor (90.4% adoption, 0.77 confidence)
Focused changes show strong correlation (82.6% adoption, 0.66 confidence)
Commit size should be flexible, not strictly enforced
100% success rate indicates mature development practices
Repository culture emphasizes documentation and organization
